episodes.title: Sexless Cult Leader? The Real History of Anne Lee and the Shakers
episodes.description:
When most people think of the Shakers, they think of colonial groups making beautifully crafted furniture…but the real history behind this religious group is far darker and stranger than well made tables and chairs. 

In this video, we dive into the unsettling life of Mother Ann Lee, the illiterate factory worker who became the "female Christ" of a movement that banned sex, marriage, and private property.

I’ll explore the rise of the "Shaking Quakers" in 18th-century England and America, asking the ultimate question: beneath the peaceful aesthetic, was this actually a dangerous cult? 

We’ll also take a look at the upcoming musical film The Testament of Ann Lee starring Amanda Seyfried. With its unique take on religious hysteria and female power, could this be the surprise hit of 2026?

Resources from this video! (Check them out, they’ve got some great archival material!)

New York State Museum Shakers Exhibit: https://exhibitions.nysm.nysed.gov/shakers/settlement.html
 
Shaker Museum: https://www.shakermuseum.us/
